comment: Worst professor I have EVER had. d2l is not organized, she's insanely disrespectful, and hates if you email her. If she makes a mistake it's automatically your fault and she will speak to you as if it's high school drama. Don't take her class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: I have never had an issue with a professor before h
rating_tags: Participation matters

comment: She is very backhanded in responding to students when they ask for help. Makes you feel very singled out when it came to anything you emailed her about yet would express to reach out if anything is needed when speaking to a class. Makes it known you are the only one with the problem and that it's your problem, not hers.

I had her for two classes, and she was wonderful! If you show that you want to learn, she'll be your biggest supporter. She knows television news. I took her for News Writing and Reporting and Sports Reporting, and she always provided good feedback.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: I've never had a problem with a professor, but this is one of the most disrespectful and unkind professors or teachers i've ever had. I've received several nasty and very strongly worded emails from Professor Payne when there was no need for such. She teaches just fine but expect to be talked to like an incompetent child. keep in mind i got an A.

She was unresponsive to messages - required multiple attempts. This professor has a strict attendance policy but even she does not adhere to it. She was late and missed class herself for the reasons she does not excuse for students. She does not seem to care about helping a student advance in the field.

Wow, I've had Professor Payne for two classes, News Reporting/Writing and Sports Reporting, and I absolutely loved her classes. I'm really surprised by the negative comments. From my experience, as long as you put in the effort, she will go above and beyond to support you. She is not just going to give you a grade.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: I personally really enjoyed her public speaking class. She gave us a really fun work environment where we were able to collaborate with each other in a safe space. She is a very hard grader and you want to make sure you do not miss a class session because you will be lost. If you miss an assignment consider yourself not getting an A anymore.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: My experience with Professor Payne at Kennesaw State University was disappointing. Her teaching style often left students struggling to grasp the material, as her explanations were unclear and lacked depth. When students sought additional help, she appeared disengaged and unwilling to offer meaningful support. She needs to be fired!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: If you ask questions she will not answer them and tell you “we've already gone over it” or “im not helping you”. She will roll her eyes and make snarky comments if you ask questions or do not understand something. If you enjoy journalism, get ready to hate it if you take her. She sucks all of the fun out of writing and takes everything personal.
rating_tags: Participation matters

comment: She is very, very difficult to work with. I don't want to break the guidelines here, but the way she treats students varies greatly based on seemingly unknown factors. You can put all of your effort into her class, and she will still not like you. Assignments are often given with confusing instructions, and she gets snippy if you ask for help.

Was a television Journalist for many years and I have taken two classes from her. She has high expectations for her students. She makes you earn your grade. Very well connected in the industry and I highly recommend.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Not a teacher that has clear rules and is not tech savvy. She is not easy to approach about things and does not teach. Only has guest speakers. Take her if you dont want to actually learn journalism techniques.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters

comment: I really like Professor Payne; she's tough but fair. She just wants her students to put in the effort, especially since many tend to seek out easy answers
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Online Savvy

comment: This professor is not helpful AT ALL! If you ask her to help you with anything, she will assume you're trying to have her do the work for you and is very rude. Do not take this class
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: Great! would take again!
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: My favorite journalism professor so far has been Professor Payne. I took her for Video News Production and also for a Maymester class and I thoroughly enjoyed both courses. She emphasizes attendance and participation in class which I found beneficial. If you follow her assignment guidelines you will do great. I would take her class again.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Gives good feedback

comment: She isn't helpful at all if you have any issues with your internship. Also, pretty rude when you bring issues to her and gives conflicting advice. Unfortunately, you have no choice but to deal with her since she's in charge of all Communication internships.

I have taken Professor Payne twice now, and plan on taking her as much as possible in the journalism program. Those who do not like her complain about her tough grading, but as long as you actually care, Professor Payne will help you with anything. She has many connections in the field, and if you want to succeed in journalism, take her.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Payne is a great professor. Although attendance is mandatory, it will help your grade and success in the field post-grad. We worked on Midterm Elections this semester and it was great to get real-world practice. Please don't be afraid to ask questions and ask for ways to improve your news package... UTILIZE OFFICE HOURS.

Right now, I have a B+ in the class. I like that we can pitch our own story ideas and we have had several quest speakers this semester. She is not going to give you anything so be prepared to work. Make sure you get your assignments in on time and ask plenty questions. She is fair if you try. I plan to take her for Video News Production.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: DON'T TAKE HER! She's literally the worst teacher I've ever had. She never teaches anything and gives bad feedback. It's literally the first news class in the program and it's to learn how to write, she just makes you write and gives you a bad grade because it's "not correct". Like teach me the dang course and I'd be able to write a good article.

Do not take.
Her instructions are unclear, she is not helpful, and she is straight up rude. She was a journalist before she taught and she expects students to know everything that she knows. She does not teach. She will call you out if you're late to class but she is often late herself.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: I had Professor Payne for Journalism Study Tour this summer, and this was a great class. I would highly recommend it. We visited news organizations and spoke to media representatives. We learned a lot in the class. Professor Payne knows Journalism and she made the class fun. I am getting ready to graduate and I wish I would have taken it earlier.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: I have Professor Payne for Video News Production and this is a great class. You are not sitting around in the classroom. You get to go out and actually cover news stories. You do work in groups. It can be stressful because you have deadlines and put together a couple of newscasts. Great energy in the class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Accessible outside class

comment: Great Professor! Had her for several classes. Also helped me to get an internship.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Payne worked in broadcast for 20 years so she has a few teacher misbehaviors. She has a bad habit of laughing and getting frustrated when students don't grasp concepts. I have heard that every professor grades assignments the same in this course so the grading is not her fault. You absolutely cannot afford to miss a class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Worst professor I have ever taken. She is so rude to all her students and she randomly freaks out and yells at everybody. She is super condescending and treats her students like elementary school children, not adults. I highly recommend not taking her unless you want your mood to be ruined every time you got to class. In general, she's MEAN.

I have never had a worse professor in my life. Says class time isn't for questions She has the audacity to be condescending and get angry when we don't understand the assignments but she gives 0 useful feedback or 0 explanations. She has no patience with her students its quite sad. She used to be a news reporter, she should have stayed there.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Hands down one of the best Journalism Professors. I had her for Video News Production. I highly recommend the class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: I have taken two classes from Professor Payne and I loved both of them. She is passionate about the subject matter. In Journalism Study Tour there were some writing assignments but nothing too hard. We visited news outlets and I learned a lot in the class. DEFINITELY take her if you can.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Video News Production and is a great class. Professor Payne will teach you how to be a solid television reporter. I love the class because we actually covered real news story and we put together several television newscasts. As I look for television jobs I plan to use the stories from this class. Best class ever!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: I have professor Payne for Journalism Study Tour. It was a great experience. She is a wealth of knowledge. I would highly recommend this class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Inspirational

comment: I have taken Professor Payne for two classes and I am taking her again for the Journalism Study Tour class. She is good at telling you what her expectations are. If you hard,, you will do well in her classes. She is one of my favorite Professors.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: Professor Payne doesn't really know how to teach and doesn't understand the software she's teaching her students about. I'm just thankful I never have to see her again.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: DO NOT TAKE THIS WOMAN. she has insane expectations for assignments (grades on quality of work rather than if you did what she asked for the assignment). could never make A's on anything, even things that I was extremely proud of. her "lectures" consist of showing us brief YouTube videos and then expecting us to understand the topics.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Professor Payne is not going to give you anything. She encourages you to learn the material on your own. Many of the editing assignments you will work independently. It can be a tough class if you do not learn the editing software because she is not going to hold your hand. I will take her again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Professor Payne was very helpful at learning the Adobe editing software. I took her for Digital Media Production and I loved the class. I learned a lot and I would definitely take her again.

comment: I had Professor Payne for Digital Media Production and I have her now for Video News Production she is great. If you do the work you have nothing to worry about. She helps you to be successful.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: This professor is unhelpful and condescending when asked any questions. Im not sure if shows knows the material because she refuses to ever answer any questions without a rude remark. Would not take.

Most condescending and rude professor ive ever had. Its not about grades, the class is not tough, its the way that she treats her students as if they are dumb if they have a question. She knows nothing about the software (most used-Premiere), she is unable to answer any questions, although shes a teacher? Wish i had dropped the class!! Dont take.

Professor Payne is the worst professor Ive taken in four years. Ive never rated a professor until now bc of how unbelievably unhelpful she is as an educator. She either does not know how to use any of the software or doesn't care, either way, she cant answer Q's. EXTREMELY RUDE & HOSTILE. Makes you never want to go to class. DO NOT TAKE HER!!!
Professor Payne is very particular about how she wants things. She will keep you on your toes the entire semester. Please do not be late and do not skip class. Not hard.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Payne is the worst professor I have ever had in my 4 years of school. She doesnt teach you how to use the equipment & software yet she expects you to just know how to do it for all of your assignments. She snaps at you and is rude if you ask her any questions, so its not like shes helpful whatsoever. Do not take her.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Professor Payne seems knowledgeable about broadcast journalism however she is very unhelpful to those that are not. Any question I asked was answered with a rude remark. She clearly does not understand how to use the software or technology because she cannot answer any questions about it. Very unclear instructions and overall rude. DONT TAKE THIS!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Payne makes the learning environment very hostile and uncomfortable. She is often very rude for no reason. She does not provide clear grading criteria, which can be frustrating especially when she assigns group projects. She seems to lack knowledge on the software and equipment. Attendance is MANDATORY! Do not recommend her.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Professor Payne is very good at what she does. The quizzes are straight forward and easy. We do not really use the book in her class. She has great power-points and online material. I have learned how use the adobe editing software in class . I am going to recommend that you are on-time and ready to work.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: I have had Professor Payne for several classes and she challenges you. In DWRI 3340 I learned how to edit and shoot video and it was one of the favorite classes. She was also instrumental in me getting an internship.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Payne is probably one of the worst professors I've ever had. She doesn't understand any of the equipment or software she's using and when someone asks a simply question, her basic response is "figure it out". She's also super disrespectful towards her students. Just spare yourself and don't take this class with her.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: If you are a Journalism major I recommend that you take Professor Payne. She is one of my favorite professors. Get ready to go out and cover real news stories. She has a lot of firsthand experience in the business and educates her students.

She is very knowledgable but tends to focus on the writing aspect of journalism, which is annoying because the class is digital media production not journalism writing. The expectations for assignments are not always clear and the way she conducts class is frustrating. She has changed the syllabus so many times it is hard to keep track.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Professor Payne will challenge you. I love her class. She is fair.

Professor Payne is outstanding and this class is a great learning opportunity. In Digital Media Production we learned how to edit, write and report. We had four major assignments in the class. She was willing to meet with us in her office. She wants you to succeed.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: I like Professor Payne's class she gives great feedback, and she is always willing to meet with you. Make sure you turn your assignments in on time. She prepares you for the real world. I would take her again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I love Professor Payne's class. You will work for your grade and if you are rude and disrespectful it will not be tolerated. She loves when students participate in class. I will take her again.
Great Professor! She definitely knows the business.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Accessible outside class

comment: This Professor is wonderful. The class is easy if you follow her directions. She gives solid examples for every assignment and straight forward instruction. If you have a problem in her class you are not trying. I actually loved her class!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: DONT TAKE HER. You have 4 big projects in the class, all of which she barely taught how to use the software and barely gave examples. There are a few assignments and quizzes in class and she takes attendance. She has terrible directions and examples and does not stick to guidelines. Dont ask her questions because she will tell you to figure it out.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: I have taken this professor for two classes and she is great. Be prepared to work hard. She has high expectations for her students. She prepares you for the real world of Journalism.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Participation matters

comment: Ms. Payne is an excellent Journalism Professor. If you are truly interested in learning the industry, she prepares you for the real world of journalism. I'm a recent graduate and I must say she is by far one of the best professors I've had at Kennesaw State.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Participation matters

comment: Please, do not take her. She has no idea how to use the equipment or the editing software used in the class, she does not teach and expects you to already know everything, and she has no respect for her students. See has no clear grading criteria, and is unorganized in D2L. Be prepared to hear, "I don't know, just figure it out".
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Professor Payne pushes you to be the best. She was always willing to help students outside of class. She does not like excuses, so turn in your work on time. I enjoyed her class and would take her again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Professor Payne is a great teacher. She will help you if you're willing to work hard. I was in a class where students just did not try and it was frustrating. You will learn Adobe software and she was very good with helping. You will have quizzes, and group projects. Do not take her class looking for a handout.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Professor Payne truly cares about her students. She is very knowledgeable in the field and will prepare you for graduation. The class has main big assignments but there is plenty of time to work on them and she will answer any questions that you have. If I could take her for every one of my Journalism classes I would.
rating_tags: Inspirational--Caring--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I love Professor Payne. She's very thorough and prepares you for the next level of the media industry as a matriculating student. She makes herself available if you are uncertain of assignments or have questions. She's there to help you. She definitely knows the media industry. I highly recommend taking her class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Participation matters

comment: She is very passionate about Journalism. If you put forth the effort, ask questions and keep her informed; she will work with you. She understands that many of us are not tech savvy and writing for broadcast is different from print. Therefore, she doesnt hold it against you on grades. She wants you to make an honest effort!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: She is very unclear on her expectations of you and assignments. She never teaches you how to do assignments, just gives you the objectives and sends you on your way. She was also very rude at times to us, even the feedback she gives from assignments is condescending. I would stay away from her classes if you can.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professor Payne knows what she is talking about. She is thorough with her work. Her philosophy is: As long as you are participating and putting in the work, you will get the grade you deserve. She is always available for out of class meeting and advising. She helped me get my portfolio put together. She knows her stuff and cares about the students
rating_tags: Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Professor Payne is one of the greatest professor's I've ever had if not the greatest. I have taken two classes with her, and while the course work is rigorous she gets you ready for the real world. She has a full career body of knowledge as a broadcaster, and helped me get a job in the industry. If you care she cares. She is a true educator.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Participation matters

comment: Serious pain in my butt is what she is. She is one of the rudest teachers I have ever taken. She is unclear in her instructions and expects all of us to know how to use a good majority of Adobe products
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Prof. Payne's expectations were so incredibly unclear for every assignment. While she is knowledgeable & passionate about reporting, she does not know production very well. She did not demonstrate how to use the apps. She mixed up the meaning of timeLIness with timeLESSness. Honestly, avoid her if you can. If you can't, good luck teaching yourself.

comment: Very nice teacher and enjoyable experience if you act like an adult in her class. Will help with clarification on assignments if you ask her. I learned a lot and will continue to take her classes! You won't do well if you act out in her classes and are disrespectful.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I loved Professor Payne! She's really understanding and accommodating with students that don't have a lot of experience with editing and production. Definitely take her for JOUR 3340!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Absolutely horrible. She does not understand how students act or need help. She asks questions on quizzes and tests that she NEVER went over. I was making an a in the class and messed up one project and ended with a 69. She also does not curve. Horrible teacher. Stay away at all cost
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Taught class based off of her job experience. Expects you to know the material and cannot explain material well. A student asked her for camera assistance for a project and she basically said "I dont know how to help you, go figure it out".
